history.content:
That schedule seems fine. Although 61C is a heavy class, 188 and C100 are pretty light (although still very technical). Would possibly leave out taking the breadth or language course if you're planning on investing a lot of time into recruiting or extracurriculars in the Fall, and just give yourself a little more breathing room to digest the material of three technical courses.

I'm a CS Peer advisor, so stop by in front of HP Auditorium M/W 2-4 PM if you want to chat more about this!

This is exactly my schedule this semester (with another light tech), and it's fine for most of the semester. It's a little rough at the moment because I have projects in all 4 classes right now, but it wasn't too bad earlier.

That schedule seems fine. Although 61C is a heavy class, 188 and C100 are pretty light (although still very technical). Would possibly leave out taking the breadth or language course if you're planning on investing a lot of time into recruiting or extracurriculars in the Fall, and just give yourself a little more breathing room to digest the material of three technical courses.

I'm a CS Peer advisor, so stop by in front of HP Auditorium M/W 2-4 PM if you want to chat more about this!

Hi I am trying to figure out my schedule for the next semester. Any idea on what the workload for 61C, 188 and Stat C100 would be? I'm also planning on possibly taking a breadth or language class. Do you think this is doable? Any advice would be greatly appreciated.
history.subject: Workload for 61C, StatC100 and 188?
